mission_task_and_description: 1st Platoon Bull Troop Sergeant's Training Time 26 February 2025

values: OIC will monitor weather and include signs of hot weather injuries in safety brief if relevant
OIC/RSO/CLS personnel understand and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
OIC will monitor weather and include signs of cold weather injuries in safety brief if relevant
OIC/RSO/CLS Personnel understands and has briefed MEDEVAC plan on the real world casualty evacuation plan.
Soldiers will have appropriate cold weather gear/clothing based on temperatures.
Shelter in place location identified in safety brief.
Listen for thunder, look for lightning.

subtasks.hazard: Hazardous troop trail conditions as a result of inclement weather (Heavy Rain, slippery roads, etc)

values: Leaders execute deliberate range reconnaissance and identify possible dangerous areas.

subtasks.hazard: Dismounts moving IVO of vehicles (crossing and traveling near roads)

values: Dismounts will move together to and from training location.
Dismounts will ensure roads are clear if/when crossing.
Soldiers will wear full Dragoon Standard.
Leaders will adhere to the PACE plan and contact emergency services in case of real world injury.
Sensitive items accounted for prior to and following each iteration.
All sensitive items tied down IAW SOP.
Sensitive Item inventory conducted following training IAW Squadron Recovery SOP.

overall_supervision_plan: The OIC is ultimately responsible for the conduct of the training area, and will continuously monitor all aspects of operations and provide updated risk assessments to the Commander as the situation develops. Safeties will remain with each element throughout training. Platoon leadership will be present with each element. In the event of a real world MEDEVAC event on site, Safeties and Training Support Personnel are responsible for ceasing training and communicating directly with the OIC to coordinate MEDEVAC.
